Class App

java.lang.Object
gui.App
public class App extends Object
The App class serves as the main entry point and manager for the Chess game application. It handles user interactions, game state management, and database operations.

Main responsibilities include: - Initializing the graphical user interface (GUI) - Communicating with the Stockfish chess engine - Managing database records for games, moves, and positions - Handling game logic such as player moves and captured pieces

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point of the application. Initializes the main menu.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used).

    • stockfishMove

      public static void stockfishMove()
      Initiates the Stockfish engine to calculate the best move and performs the move.

    • getStockfishMove

      public static String getStockfishMove(String FEN)
      Retrieves the best move from the Stockfish engine given a position in FEN format.
      Parameters:
      FEN - The FEN representation of the current board position.
      Returns:
      The best move calculated by Stockfish.

    • insertNewGame

      public static void insertNewGame(String myColor)
      Inserts a new game record into the database with the specified player's color.
      Parameters:
      myColor - The color the player has chosen ("White" or "Black").

    • editEndGame

      public static void editEndGame(String myColor, String result)
      Updates the game record in the database when the game ends.
      Parameters:
      myColor - The color of the player.
      result - The result of the game ("White", "Black", or "Draw").

    • insertNewMove

      public static void insertNewMove(int moveNumber, String playerTurn, String moveNotation)
      Inserts a new move record into the database.
      Parameters:
      moveNumber - The move number in the game.
      playerTurn - The player who made the move ("White" or "Black").
      moveNotation - The move in chess notation.

    • insertPlayers

      public static void insertPlayers(String myColor, String opponentColor)
      Inserts player details into the database for the current game.
      Parameters:
      myColor - The player's color.
      opponentColor - The opponent's color.

    • editCapturedPieces

      public static void editCapturedPieces(boolean isMyCapture, String capturedPiece)
      Updates the record of captured pieces for a player in the database.
      Parameters:
      isMyCapture - Whether the piece was captured by the player.
      capturedPiece - The captured piece.

    • insertNewPosition

      public static void insertNewPosition(int positionNumber, String fenString)
      Inserts a new board position record into the database.
      Parameters:
      positionNumber - The position number in the game.
      fenString - The FEN representation of the position.

    • startMenu

      public static void startMenu()
      Displays the main menu of the application.

    • selectColorMenu

      public static void selectColorMenu()
      Displays the color selection menu for the player.

    • gameFrame

      public static void gameFrame()
      Initializes and displays the main game frame.

    • startGame

      public static void startGame(Player.ColorOption colorOption, JFrame colorFrame)
      Starts a new game by disposing of the color selection frame, initializing a game with the chosen color, and opening the game frame. Also determines if it's the user's turn based on the chosen color.
      Parameters:
      colorOption - the selected color for the player.
      colorFrame - the JFrame used for color selection.

    • endGame

      public static void endGame(String result)
      Displays a dialog showing the game result and provides options to restart or exit the game.
      Parameters:
      result - the result of the game (e.g., "White wins", "Black wins", or "Draw").
